title: chore: update metapac and prepare embassy-stm32 0.3.0
book: Suggest Picotool for RP chips instead of elf2uf2-rs
body:
This amends the FAQ section of the book to suggest the use of [Picotool](https://github.com/raspberrypi/picotool) to upload binaries to RP2* chips without using a debug probe, instead of [`elf2uf2-rs`](https://github.com/JoNil/elf2uf2-rs/).

As of Rust 1.89, the stable compiler emits ELF binaries that contain a header that [fails an overly strict check in elf2uf2-rs](https://github.com/JoNil/elf2uf2-rs/issues/40). In addition, elf2uf2-rs appears to be unmaintained, while Picotool is maintained by the vendor.

The link in the amended documentation is to the [pico-sdk-tools repo](https://github.com/raspberrypi/pico-sdk-tools), not the Picotool repo, as it is where the pre-built binaries are published.

title: Feat/add vrefbuf driver
body: Also updated stm32-data-generated to latest

title: Add methods for idle-state control in STM32 Complementary PWM
body:
The idle state is determined by the MOE, OSSI, OSSR, OISx and OISxN bits according to the 334 in the RM0433 Reference manual. This PR adds interfaces for controlling these bits.

The set_output_idle_state method, controlling OISx and OISxN, sets the idle state as inverted as both channels are configured with the same polarity in set_polarity method and idle state can't be that both are active.

title: Updated stm32-metapac for GPDMA1 fix on STM32WBA
body: This PR updates `stm32-metapac` based on this [PR](https://github.com/embassy-rs/stm32-data/pull/655). With this in place more peripherals can use DMA channels on the STM32WBA series.

title: chore: prepare release of embassy-nrf and embassy-rp
removed the rp2040 flag from the dormant function
body:
It doesn't seem like there's any working option for low power modes on the rp235x.

The dormant_sleep() function is enabled in the rp2040, and disabled in the rp235x with a conditional compilation flag.  The datasheet for the rp2350(page 489) says that the state is still supported.

removing the flag and enabling the necessary dependencies for it seemed like the low hanging fruit.

I tried it on my project (https://github.com/Nicholas-L-Johnson/flip-card) and it works well, with 1/10 of the power usage compared to just .await-ing everything, and wakes as expected on GPIO high signal.

title: Release embassy-embedded-hal v0.4
feat: lpc55 blocking usart added
body:
Hello! For LPC55 USART with blocking mode was implemented.

- Implemented structure `Usart` which can be split into `UsartRx` and `UsartTx`
- Implemented `Blocking` mode
- Added `Config` and `Error`
- All the sufficient IO-functions for `Blocking` mode were implemented
- `Usart` was made generic for the sake of flexibility
- All the interactions with PAC are hidden macro called `impl_instance!()`
- Added USART peripherals for LPC55
- Added example `usart_blocking.rs` for demonstration

@george-cosma, please review this PR

STM32 CAN: Add mutable access for ID in Header and Frame structs
body: In communication protocols like CANopen, the message ID is often a combination of a base arbitration ID and a specific node ID. To support a similar mechanism I need to modify the arbitration ID by adding the node ID before the message is transmitted.

title: STM32WBA usb-dfu example
body:
With the addition of USB_OTG_HS support on the WBA65 devices I took the liberty of adapting the current examples on the STM32WB devices to my Nucleo board. The main differences are:

- The memory.x files for both the application and the bootloader have to account for the larger flash and memory (1/2MM and 256/512KB)
- The new examples run off the HSI (in case the HSE isn't connected to a crystal)
- The examples are proven to work on the STM32WBA65RIVx Nucleotide board.

So here they are.

title: Feat/stm32wba usb example
body:
The STM32WBA65RI device has USB_OTG_HS unlike the STM32WBA5XXX series devices. This necessitates moving and creating some examples using this device. The USB peripheral and these additional examples are confirmed to work on the NUCLEO_STM32WBA65RIVx.

- Fixes to USB_OTG_HS initialization
- WBA65 USB core ID is 6100. Added new config check (used same config as u5 - works fine)
- All previous WBA examples ported to new device (minor pin remapping)

body: Fixes some logical errors in the state of the WiFi link.

title: Add missing `PartialEq` and `Eq` trait derives to `embassy-net` config structs
body: This PR adds missing equality comparison traits to some of the `embassy-net` `Config`-related structs, enabling config change detection routines ("detect user switch from DHCP to static configuration in the web UI.")

title: stm32: fix build for stm32c09x
Add `embassy-net` `defmt` derives for config structs
body: This PR adds some missing `defmt` derives to `embassy-net` so that IP address and other configuration can more easily be inspected.

title: Added support for PLL as a clock source on STM32WBA
body:
The RCC HAL for WBA devices had support for HSE and HSI but not for the PLL. That support has been added due to the recent additions in `stm32-data` that added the PLL enums. With that in place a new addition is the inclusion of sanity checks for the PLL VCO generated frequency (it'll panic just like in the U5 HAL). That aside there's also the addition of the PLLFRACN fractional multiplier. That has also been added. The frequency asserts also take this PLLFRACN into account.

A timer example has also been added showcasing this new support for the PLL.

title: feat: add divs/divt for stm32h7rs
body:
* stm32h7rs includes 2 additional pll divisors: divs and divt
* these changes make those divisors available in embassy-stm32/src/rcc/h.rs

title: feat: add RTC time driver
embassy-embedded-hal: make time feature non-default
body: default features considered harmful.

title: fix: stm32 i2c slave blocking r/w
body:
originally from #4316

- removed defmt:: and explicit defmt cfg checks
- rebased

closes #4316

This fixes an issue where the slave interface would time out when the
master goes from a short write to a read (e.g. when accessing memory
registers) with a START signal between. The previous implementation
would expect the full buffer length to be written before starting to
listen to new commands.

This also adds debug trace printing which helped during implemention and
testing.

Places error checking into a function inspired from a C implementation
of HAL.

title: feat(embedded-hal)!: rely on v1.0 traits for `BlockingAsync`
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/pull/2910#issuecomment-2637965968, this changes `BlockingAsync` to rely on v1.0 `embedded-hal` traits to provide the implementations of `I2c` and `SpiBus`, instead of the v0.2 traits. This makes `BlockingAsync` usable on types that only implement the v1.0 traits, like `esp_hal::spi::master::Spi` [since v0.23.0](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md#removed-4).

I do not think it is possible to keep the implementations relying on the v0.2 traits at the same time, possibly because of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/20400.

BREAKING CHANGE: this is a breaking change as this would not work anymore if the inner type only implements the v0.2 traits.

---

Feel to push to this PR branch as needed.

title: add missing `Debug` and `defmt::Format` derives for `embassy_rp::gpio`

title: nxp: make docs generate
executor: mark unsafe tasks as unsafe
body:
Currently creating a task creating from a unsafe function doesn't make the newly created task unsafe. e.g.
```rust
#[embassy_executor::task]
async unsafe fn oops() {}

let token = oops();
```
compiles even if it shouldn't. Fixing this is a breaking change.

title: chore: Prepare release for `embassy-boot-*` crates
body: Prepare the bootloader crates for a release with `embassy-sync@0.7.0` as dependency for compatiblity with other released crates. `embassy-sync` is used in the public api of `embassy-boot` which is reexported by the `embassy-boot-*` crates. That is why a minor version bump of all crates is required.

https://cdn.sparkfun.com/assets/1/6/c/b/b/STM32WB55xx_Reference_Manual.pdf @ 16.4.29 - oversampling is configured using the same registers as on G0 and U0 (except OVSE -> ROVSE for regular oversampling mode)

Requires https://github.com/embassy-rs/stm32-data/pull/647

The start of #4345, this time the IMXRT parts.

So far a GPIO and time driver.

The PIT driver is a bit unfortunate for the moment with the potential drift. Will see in the future if the general purpose timer can do a better job.

title: Added RTC low-power support for STM32WBA
body:
- Added low-power feature for STM32WBA65RI build in ci.sh
- RTC APB registers are different in STM32WBA6 than in STM32U5 so the embassy RTC low-power function calls had to be changed.

title: feat(embassy-nrf): add uicr hfxo workaround
body:
In the nRF MDK, there is a workaround "UICR_HFXO_WORKAROUND"  that resests the HFXO values if they are erased. This is necessary on my nrf9151 to have the modem working properly.

I found this thanks to these two messages:
https://github.com/diondokter/nrf-modem/issues/32#issuecomment-2704598018  
https://devzone.nordicsemi.com/f/nordic-q-a/96093/nrf9160-porting-the-modem-library-to-work-with-bare-metal-application/435351?focus=true

I'm not sure I placed this workaround in the correct place, or if this should be handled by embassy-nrf.

I tested this on the nrf9151 of a Thingy91 X, without this workaround the modem gets stuck in initialization, with the workaround it works as intended.

title: feat: added log-to-defmt feature to embassy-nxp
body:
- Added an option of using ```log``` crate so that it is printed via ```defmt```
- Added a small example for this (```examples/lpc55s69/src/bin/log_to_defmt.rs```)

It would be great if ```embassy-nxp``` had ```log``` crate support for debugging in the future. For this I have added ```log-to-defmt``` crate and ```log_to_defmt``` feature in ```Cargo.toml```. It can be tested using ```--feature``` flag while calling ```cargo run```.

title: RP2350: Fix PIO clock divider in the blinky Wi-Fi example
body: I was unable to initialize CYW43 chip on my Raspberry Pi Pico 2 W with the `DEFAULT_CLOCK_DIVIDER`. The solution comes from here: https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/issues/3612.

title: STM32F107: Fix inadvertent re-configuration of the SWJ/JTAG pins when activating the (R)MII interface
body: AFIO_MAPR.SWJ_CFG must be written as 0b111 to leave its value unchanged.

title: Removed reference to ADC3 for STM32G4x1 if the peripheral does not exist
body:
Fixes regression introduced in https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/pull/4390 for STM32G431 and STM32G441, which do not have an ADC3. Results in the build failing.

STM32G491 and STM32G4A1 do have the instance, so this is the easiest way to gate these `impl`s.

title: mspm0: add buffered uart driver
Add STM32WBA USB_OTG_HS support
body:
This PR attempts to align the USB_OTG_HS support present in the STM32U5 series now to the STM32WBA family of devices.

- Some register names were slightly altered so those had to be addressed.
- An enum had to be handled.
- Thank you to Dario for fixing the build issues I was having 😄

title: stm32: fix stm32g0b0 build.
body: It has USB but not HSI48 which would break things. Only g0x1 has HSI48.

title: Fix stm32 buffered half-duplex uart receive
body: This fixes an issue described in #3679 comments where receiver was never reenabled.

title: Add `derive(Debug)` for `embassy_rp::i2c::I2c`
body: i've split this in two commits since i'm not sure if you want to take the second one (enabling the warning without adding all the derives - on the other hand, if i'd add them then i'd turn it into a `deny`)

title: RP2350: Correct SRAM8 and SRAM9 base addresses in example memory.x
body:
According to [datasheet](https://datasheets.raspberrypi.com/rp2350/rp2350-datasheet.pdf) (page 31), the base addresses specified as SRAM4 and SRAM5 in the example linker script should actually be SRAM8 and SRAM9.

There are 10 SRAM banks on the chip with the following base addresses:

- 0x20000000: SRAM_BASE
- 0x20000000: SRAM_STRIPED_BASE
- 0x20000000: SRAM0_BASE
- 0x20040000: SRAM4_BASE
- 0x20080000: SRAM_STRIPED_END
- 0x20080000: SRAM8_BASE
- 0x20081000: SRAM9_BASE
- 0x20082000: SRAM_END

If the example linker script is not incorrect, please share the reason as I haven't been able to find out why it's set that way.

title: nrf: add support for nrf9120, nrf9151, nrf9161 approtect.
feat: add embassy-release tool
body:
* Print dependencies of a crate
* Bump version in dependent crates
* Release using cargo release
* Config file to control features and target

The idea is that the tool can be used to simplify the tasks of releasing, and gradually performing more and more of the tasks required to do a release. It's not intended as yet another release tool for rust, but for calling out to other tools to do the tasks required for a release.

title: otg: Improve IN write performance
body:
chunks_exact() can be handled by the compiler more efficiently. Previous code was making a memcpy call for each 4 byte chunk slice. Hoisting the fifo out of the loop avoids recalculating the pointer each time.

In my benchmark I see a jump from ~13 megabyte/sec to ~25MB/sec after this change (opt-level=3). opt-level = "z" goes 9MB/s to 18MB/s.

The benchmark was on a stm32h7s3l8, 600mhz clock, 512 byte bulk writes, data in DTCM. The benchmark isn't just USB writes, also has some unrelated memcpys for packet construction.

title: docs: add missing feature for doc gen
Make USB endpoint allocator methods accept an optional `EndpointAddress`
body:
This PR adds an optional `ep_addr` to all USB endpoint allocation methods. If a method receives`None`, the old incremental allocation behavior applies.

This enables developers to select a specific endpoint index, enabling implementation and emulation of devices where endpoints are hardcoded (e.g. FTDI USB-to-serial adapters).

I am still testing this on the various platforms that I have on hand, just wanted to get this open for discussion re: modifying these interfaces; there are a few places where this parameter doesn't necessarily need to be exposed (we can default to `None`).

title: Fix CDC ACM BufferedReceiver buffer calculation
Fixing the nrf54l drive configuration bug
body: Fixes a mistake that misconfigures the drive pins for the nrf54l I notice while working on the support for the nrf54l.

title: [STM32G4] Introduce traits for special ADC channels
body:
Not all special channels like Temperature are available on all ADCs and they don't always use the same channel number.

This PR introduces traits that have associated consts for the channels.
The traits are also used as bounds for the functions to create the channels.

This works for H7 as well, but I've implemented the traits for with the same old channels on all ADCs to keep it on par with what previously was. But now at least someone could come in and make it more granular for H7 too.

title: embassy_stm32: fix typo in timer::one_pulse
some minor documentation fixes
body: cargo doc threw some errors.. some of them simple to fix, for the others I hopefully corrected them correctly based on the context :) In some cases, there were references to private API

title: add embassy sync channel example for message passing between interrupt and task
executor: mark Spawner::for_current_executor() as unsafe.
body: It's unsound with manually-created Contexts, see https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/issues/4379

title: excutor: fix Send unsoundness with `-> impl Future` tasks.
embassy-executor: rtos-trace: fix task naming for new tasks
body: Tasks that are spawned after starting SystemViewer were not named. This change ensures that tasks spawned while SystemViewer is running will be properly named, too.

title: embassy-stm32: Added sample shifting to qspi config
body:
I noticed the sample shifting configuration for the stm32 QSPI driver is missing as `QUADSPI.cr().sshift()` is always set to `false` on initialization [here](https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/blob/main/embassy-stm32/src/qspi/mod.rs#L123). 

This PR adds the sample shifting option found in the STM32 CubeIDE to the existing embassy-stm32 QSPI Config.

title: Add note about UART line breaks being different from ASCII
body: I confused myself for a while because I'm working with a GPS module that sends an ASCII line break character (\n) to indicate the end of a transmission. I initially thought `read_to_break` would read until it saw a line break character, but it actually does the (much more sensible) reading until a UART break condition is encountered. This adds that distinction to the docs.

title: stm32: Fix impl embedded_hal_nb::serial::Write for usart::UartTx
body: It fixes `impl embedded_hal_nb::serial::Write for usart::UartTx` because old code calls `blocking_write` in non blocking trait.

title: net: correct `UdpSocket::recv_from_with` docs
rp: add current_core api
body: This PR adds a new API within the embassy-rp multicore module to get which core the code is currently executing on. This is similar to functionality already present in the embassy-stm32 crate.

title: embassy-nrf: fix PWM loop count
body:
The PWM sequencer offers to run a sequence for a limited time by specifying `SingleSequenceMode::Times(n)` with `n > 0`.

Currently this value is ignored and the loop register is set to `1`.

This PR fixes the behaviour. It has been tested using a NRF9160 in secure mode.

title: Link to esp-generate
body: Some people are trying to use cargo-embassy for our chips and end up disappointed. Let's link to the vendor-supported generator.

title: Use proper RCC clock enable for opamps
body:
OpAmp::new() now resets the opamp and enables its clock. The clock disabled when the opamp is dropped. On families that use SYSCFGEN (F3 and G4), this is not done because clock is always on in Embassy.
    
This change makes use of the RCC driver, which uses a reference counter to prevent conflicts. The opamp itself is still disabled when its output is dropped.

The PR intentionally does not add opamp features for more families yet to make reviewing easier.

The following table shows the opamp clock enable bits for all families, taken from RMs and/or CubeMX generated code:

| Family  | Example     | RCC       |
| ------- | ----------- | --------- |
| L1 (*)  | STM32L152RE | COMPEN    |
| F3      | STM32F303K8 | SYSCFGEN  |
| L4      | STM32L432KC | OPAMPEN   |
| L4+     | STM32L4P5ZG | OPAMPEN   |
| H7      | STM32H755ZI | OPAMPEN   |
| L5      | STM32L552ZE | OPAMPEN   |
| G4      | STM32G474RE | SYSCFGEN  |
| U5      | STM32U545RE | OPAMPEN   |
| H5      | STM32H503RB | OPAMPEN   |
| U0      | STM32U031R8 | OPAMPEN   |
| U3      | STM32U385RG | OPAMPEN   |

(*) L1 OPAMP not yet in stm32-data

title: Adds ADC4 for STM32WBA series
body:
This adds ADC support for the WBA series, using the already existing ADC4 support for the U5 series.
This was tested on a WBA55CG. 
There are probably some simplifications to be made, but this at least works.

I haven't tested the u5 after these changes because I don't own one.

title: Update Rust nightly, stable.
mspm0: Fix inverted GPIO logic
body: `get_output_level()` was attempting to read the input buffer, which is currently disabled by this HAL when a pin is configured as an `Output`, resulting in a constant logical low reading. After fixing this I noticed that the equivalent input reading logic was inverted. This PR fixes both issues.

title: Minimise build profile tweaking in rp/rp235x examples
body:
To avoid confusion around build profile tweaks (see #4346), remove optimisation/lto changes and just enable generation of debug symbols for release profiles.
Also add a comment explaining that it is intentional so it is less likely to be seen as a mistake in the examples.

title: [stm32h723]: fix spdifrx example
body: The STM32H723 SPDIF RX example was not yet adapted to the new `Peri` API and thus failed to compile. This PR remedies that.

title: [stm32]: Replace per-channel traits in `timer` module with generic versions
Fix Release and Dev Profiles Being Backwards in rp235x Examples
nxp: add feature for lpc55
body: this is needed since I will be working on adding support for the MCX and iMXRT families to embassy-nxp

title: Added STM32WBA6XXX devices as features
body:
Added the following
- new devices (a.k.a. features) from `stm32-data`
- within `ci.sh`: attempt to build 2 `stm32wba6[2|5]` devices
- handled a default rtc implementation if the generated peripherals didn't match the mapping.
- handled a new generated peripheral `rtc_v3c0` recently introduced to `stm32-data-generated`

title: Adapt to new opamp pin naming scheme and opamp IP version numbers
body:
The new code implements the corresponding traits for the common opamp pin naming scheme of all families, which is VINPx/VINMx and adapts the opamp driver to new opamp IP version numbers.

The same pin must not be used for multiple channels for the same opamp. For example, if VINM0 and VINM1 of the same opamp were assigned to the same pin, the channel would not be unique, meaning that the traits would be implemented in a conflicting manner.

title: Correct esp-hal link
body:
Every other link points to the relevant HAL, let's not confuse Espressif users 🙃

This is also my sneaky way to prioritize esp-hal over esp-idf-svc for newcomers.

title: mspm0: add dma driver
body:
Add a DMA driver for mspm0. So far only implement features available on all (basic) channels. copying slices is also not implemented yet nor anything related to source/destination stride. 

~~A few things pending before this is ready to review~~
- [x] merge https://github.com/mspm0-rs/mspm0-data/pull/6
- [x] add tests for u16, u32 and u64 transfers
- [x] ~~Figure out why `TransferMode::Single` with `dst.len() > 2` performs 2 transfers instead of 1 (as expected in datasheet)~~ (likely hardware bug)
- [x] ~~Test multiple triggers (`resume()`)~~
- [x] Remove the settings.json changes (after I am done)
